channel.title: UWT on custom workstation
channel.description:
Custom debian workstation with uwt installed from repos. I find it hard to get information about implementing uwt on a custom workstation, does any documentation exist?
Following error is being received when I try and run apt-get, ssh, etc
/etc/uwt.d/30_uwt_default: line 52: error: command not found ## uwtwrapper BUG. ## SCRIPTNAME: uwtwrapper ## uwtwrapper_parent: /usr/bin/apt-get ## BASH_COMMAND: error "/usr/bin/"$SCRIPTNAME" uwt wrapper could not determine if this is Whonix-Workstation or Whonix-Gateway." ## Please report this BUG!

item.title: UWT on custom workstation
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
No documentation exists. That use case is unsupported, because there is no maintainer who supports that use case.

Explained here:

GitHub

Whonix/uwt

Use Applications over Tor with Stream Isolation and Time Privacy - for better anonymity / privacy. - Whonix/uwt

Slightly improved the error text in git:

github.com/Whonix/uwt

output

committed 09:19AM - 14 Nov 14 UTC
adrelanos
+12 -2

(Underline added to match your case.)

[u]uwt wrapper could not determine if this is Whonix-Workstation or Whonix-Gateway.[/u] Variable uwtwrapper_gateway_ip does not exist early enough in /etc/uwt.d. [u]If you are using a Custom-Workstation, please consider installing the anon-gw-base-files or anon-ws-base-files package.[/u] If you are not using a Custom-Workstation: please report this bug!

Read full topic

item.title: UWT on custom workstation
item.dc:creator: paperboy
item.description:
Custom debian workstation with uwt installed from repos. I find it hard to get information about implementing uwt on a custom workstation, does any documentation exist?

Following error is being received when I try and run apt-get, ssh, etc

/etc/uwt.d/30_uwt_default: line 52: error: command not found

uwtwrapper BUG.

SCRIPTNAME: uwtwrapper

uwtwrapper_parent: /usr/bin/apt-get

BASH_COMMAND: error “/usr/bin/”$SCRIPTNAME" uwt wrapper could not determine if this is Whonix-Workstation or Whonix-Gateway."

Please report this BUG!

Read full topic
